awards.description: THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE KNIK TRIBE IN BUILDING CAPACITY AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH.  TASKS INCLUDE MAINTAINING AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND PROGRAM; RESEARCHING ISSUES AND RESOURCES AND ATTENDING TRAINING; COLLABORATING WITH OTHER AGENCIES AND CONDUCTING OUTREACH; UPDATING THE ENVIRONMENTAL INVENTORY; DEVELOPING THE GIS PROGRAM; AND DEVELOPING A PLAN FOR SURFACE WATER QUALITY ASSESSMENT.    NOTE: THE INDIRECT COST RATE AGREEMENT ON FILE WITH EPA EXPIRED 09/30/2016, YOU MAY NOT DRAW DOWN FUNDS FOR INDIRECT COSTS WITHOUT A CURRENT, APPROVED RATE IN PLACE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS PROJECT WILL ASSIST THE KNIK TRIBE IN BUILDING CAPACITIES AND DEVELOPING PROGRAMS TO PROTECT THE TRIBAL ENVIRONMENT AND HEALTH.  OBJECTIVES/WORKPLAN COMPONENTS INCLUDE: 1. BUILDING ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY; 2. BUILDING PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY; 3. BUILDING COMMUNICATIONS CAPACITY; AND 4. BUILDING TECHNICAL CAPACITY.ACTIVITIES:WORKPLAN ACTIVITIES/TASKS INCLUDE: MAINTAINING AN ENVIRONMENTAL OFFICE AND ADMINISTRATIVE AND PROGRAM MANAGEMENT FUNCTIONS; ATTENDING TRAINING AND RESEARCHING ISSUES AND RESOURCES; COMMUNICATING INTERNALLY AND EXTERNALLY ABOUT ISSUES AND CONDUCTING COMMUNITY EDUCATION ACTIVITIES; BUILDING TECHNICAL KNOWLEDGE OF WATER QUALITY AND WETLANDS ISSUES; HOSTING WETLANDS AND CONSERVATION TRAININGS; DEVELOPING AN ENVIRONMENTAL INVENTORY; BUILDING A GEOGRAPHIC INFORMATION SYSTEMS PROGRAM; DEVELOPING AN AERIAL IMAGING PROJECT; AND PLANNING TO EXPAND A TRIBAL TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE PROGRAM.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT ARE THE KNIK TRIBE, TRIBAL MEMBERS, AND THE LOCAL PUBLIC.  THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE: INCREASING TRIBAL ADMINISTRATIVE CAPACITY TO RESPOND TO LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS; INCREASING TRIBAL PROGRAMMATIC CAPACITY TO ASSESS LOCAL ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES; INCREASING COMMUNITY KNOWLEDGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND ACTIONS PROTECTIVE OF THE ENVIRONMENT; AND INCREASING TRIBAL TECHNICAL CAPACITIES TO PRIORITIZE ENVIRONMENTAL NEEDS AND DEVELOP PROGRAMS TO ADDRESS THEM.  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE: PERFORMANCE REPORTS; FINANCIAL REPORTS; COPIES OF OUTREACH MATERIALS; EVENT SUMMARY REPORTS; AN UPDATED ENVIRONMENTAL INVENTORY; REPRESENTATIVE SAMPLE MAPS; AND A QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN FOR AN AERIAL IMAGING PROJECT.
DIST. OF CHILD CARE DEVELOPMENT FUNDS (DISCRETIONARY) - CORONAVIRUS RESPONSE AND RELIEF SUPPLEMENTAL ASSOCIATION (CRRSA) ALLOCATED FOR INCLUSION IN APPROVED P.L. 102-477 PLANS

DISTS. FOR TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PROGRAM AND TRIBAL TRANSPORTATION PLANNING FOR ACTIVITIES/PROJECTS DESCRIBED IN 23 USC 202(A) AND A FHWA APPROVED TRANSPORTATION IMPROVEMENT PROGRAM (TIP), 23 USC 202(C)(3).
DISTRIBUTIONS FOR SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS (TPA BASE) CR1/CR2 AND CONTRACT SUPPORT CR#1 (14.21%) AND CR#2 (7.92%) OF 2019 ENACTED

DISTS. FOR SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS FY 21 CR1 (19.73%) TPA BASE AND SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS FOR TPA BASE AT 80.27% OF THE CR ANNUAL RATE OF OPERATIONS OF THE TRIBAL PRIORITY ALLOCATION (TPA) PROGRAMS.
SELF GOVERNANCE COMPACTS (TPA BASE) CR1 (17.53%) DISTRIBUTION

awards.awarding_agency: Department of Housing and Urban Development
